description: We are one in Harmony - Listen to the Rainbow Song I am here for the love. And LOVE is the best thing that can ever happen to us. So I won't exclude anybody from my love because of their gender, origin or sexual orientation. Everyone is worth to be loved! We are all one before God. A D D M Y F A C E B O O K P A G E S: Personal Page Lilyas Art Page Lilyas Fanclub The Chromatic Deck Playing Cards The Pure Mandala This is my official submission to DeviantArt's Pride Month Project. I hope you like the spiritually themed mandala. I have chosen the color orange from the Pride flag. This color is associated with the meaning of HEALING. There is still so much healing necessary in terms of the LGBTQ+ community. I strongly support this kind of healing work though I don't especially consider myself as part of LGBTQ+. I understand that many people fight for their rights to be what they feel they are but I myself don't have issues with my gender identity or sexual orientation. If you ask me in what way I identify myself I will tell you this: There is no label for my way of being. I am not simply bisexual or heterosexual or whatever - I am just SEXUAL. I am sexual being that is open to make sexual experiences of all kind. I don't prefer any kind of special men or women while others I have aversion for. If you have an open heart I am able to love you no matter if you are old or young, tall or short, big or slim, black or white, where you are coming from and what you have done. No matter who you are - I want to encourage you go for that what comes from your heart. Don't let anyone prevent you from being what you are and doing what you heart tells you is right - even when they judge you and segregate you for that. It's better to be hated for what you are than loved for what you are not. Other spiritual works © Copyright by Lily A. Seidel 2017. All rights reserved. You may not use my work without my written permission.

description: Hello, deviants! How are you today? Here's my holiday greeting! And it says Happy Halloween! That means that I was hoping that you have a great Halloween! For everything seen in this greeting, Kai is dressed as Harry Potter, Lilith is dressed as Morrigan from Darkstalkers, and every decorations, including bats, jack-o'-lanterns, and a ghost, are based of Halloween! Also, Kai and Lilith carried their buckets filled with candy and are greeting you guys with Halloween spirit! (This means that I chose Kai and Lilith as mascots!) Anyways, please ENJOY! And Happy Halloween! Azai Kai, Lilith (c) YugoNaru (me) Harry Potter (c) J.K. Rowling Morrgian Aensland, Darkstalkers (c) Capcom Also, feel free to download it or buy it as a print, if you like!

description: FACEBOOK FANPAGE | TUMBLR | TWITTER Christmas presents dont substitute for a familly. Even if she lives in this big and warn house, Even if she get a lot of presents, Everything is cold today. And even if it is too early, sincerely, Joyeux Noël ! (it means Happy Christmas of course ) I know I drew a sad drawing, even though Christmas is an happy day. But this drawing my present for you. Of course I dont say that to get more favs o_o; I just wanted draw something for you, for Christmas. I dont like... this drawing, hum...ok, I explain, I think is quite flat, but I will do better for the next ! This character is called Jade, indeed it's a new character I wanted to draw something for Christmas, but something which is supposed to be original, not too foolish or macabre.... I was inspired by a photo [link] from ~ForestFaeri (Thank you ) The pose is hard to do, very hard so indeed I drew bad the pose ^^ Time: 24 hours Software: Photoshop 7 Tool: Mouse

description: Attention Odyssey Project mods! If you need this image in a larger size, please let me know! As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- That night he dreamed of an ocean, somewhere far, far away. Something large and shapeless, sparkling like a star-covered sky, swam past and circled around him. Orbs of light blinked in and out of existence as a Voice echoed within his skull. Please, We Must Help Mother. Submission for the Odyssey II Project chapter 4. Another super fun chapter! I know that the chapter is trying to make the nature of the spawn ambiguous as to whether it is an ally or a foe, but I dunno. I wanted to draw a horrible monster fish. Besides, who's to say that just because it looks awful, means that it's a bad guy, you know? Wouldn't that be more unexpected to have to trust the scary sea monster because it's actually the pretty girl who is the dangerous one? This took a million redraws to get just right. I am so damned sick of redrawing those damned little teeth! Acrylic ink and a bit of tinkering with photoshop to add effects (the stars) and punch up some washed-out colors. ----- Prologue [link] (runner up) Chapter 1 [link] (winner) Chapter 2 [link] (runner up) Chapter 3 [link] (runner up) Chapter 5 [link] (runner up) Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] (runner up) Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

But hey, it's something fluffy and white so I suppose I shouldn't be surpirsed that he likes it so much! Had I been more imaginative I might have put a fluffy kitten at his feet, but meh. I wanted it to be pretty clean and simple and kitten might have cluttered it up too much. ...because red Christmas outfits are so overrated. Happy holidays all. Black ink and Photoshop. description: I decided to join in on the fun of DA's !7th b-day!! XD Speedpaint: youtu.be/aWX_V7IdEPw It took me around 8 hours to complete this but I'm happy with the results. It's been a while since the last time I made a big art work like this. It was tough but it was fun! The character who has messy hair and blue eyes is Kian Francis Rivera, an OC of mine. The other guy with a very fab hair is Clyde Inoue, also an OC of mine. Both of them has a very unique and mutual bond. Clyde practices his skills in hair styling by taming the monstrous hair that belongs to Kian. While Kian practices his drawing skills with the help of Clyde as his model. And one thing in common for them is that they are both Asians. Kian is half-Filipino, and Clyde is half-Japanese. That's probably why they get along well, since both of them really CANNOT LIVE without rice. Kian and Clyde (c) me Art (c) me and of course Happy b-day Deviant Art!!

description: "Dragon Lore" (The Guardian) -- line art in pen on paper, digitally colored in Corel Painter on Intuos 3 tablet ***Full View Recommended*** 2012's first piece for the Enchanted Visions Project (theme for January 2012), "Dragon Lore". I chose to go with the image of a green dragon emerging from a tattoo on a woman's back. The dragon is a much revered creature in Eastern cultures. China has an extensive list of dragon colors and their attributes. In feng shui, the green dragon is considered the bringer of good fortune, good health, and luck, and it is associated with the direction East. And of course, the Chinese New Year that's coming up is January 23 this year, and it's the Year of the Dragon. Happy New Year! ©2012 Mitzi Sato-Wiuff/Aruarian Dancer www.AuroraWings.com

I'm doing my best to make this the best guide possible =3 EDITS! V1.3 - Polysexual Pride Flag has been added. Updated definition for Bear Brotherhood. V1.2 - A number of definitions have been updated to better represent the groups their flag represents V1.1 - Background changed, fonts changed, updated definitions for Bear Brotherhood and Gay Pride, bottom credit changed V1.03 - Updated definitions of "Lipstick Lesbian" and "Bear Pride" V1.02 - Updated definition for "Bisexual Pride." description: This is my participation to the international Cheetah Day Challenge ! The International Cheetah Day Challenge! International Cheetah Day is here!!! Using Art to Save a Species! Welcome to the International Cheetah Day Challenge! What is this challenge, you ask? Well... The International Cheetah Day Challenge (ICDC) is the day when you, supporters of saving the endangered cheet My first cheetah ever ! Frankly I am really happy about this pic, I had a lot of fun drawing it ! I think it's also because this is my favourite "big cat" (with the cougar). First I wanted to draw a cartoon version... but I really wanted to know if I was capable to correctly draw a realistic cheetah. You can also find this pic on FurAffinity www.furaffinity.net/view/93897… , SoFurry www.sofurry.com/view/470626 and tumblr berrizcombo.tumblr.com/post/37… . Thanks to all the people who participate to this day, I've see such beautiful pics already... let deviantART be full of cheetah today ! Please, check the Cheetah Conservation Fund's website and the Sta.sh about the Cheetah Day Challenge. This painting is avaible on print. All the money recieved from the sales of this pic will be transfered to the Cheetah Conservation Fund. [Edit]: Ho my god, this pic recieved a CUTE Badge from WhisperMeWish group ! Thank you so much ! Creation time: 5 hours Software: Photoshop CS5 Layers: 5 Hardware:Wacom Intuos4 Reference: random cheetah images from the internet Textures: no Real size: 11x8inches (30x21 cm) Date of creation: 04.12.2012 Digital painting © Black_Berry for the international Cheetah Day Challenge Do you like it ? Become a fan on Facebook and visit my tumblr to see original sketches and WIP!

Lineart about 2 or 2 and a half hours (I repainted a picture of Moonwalker, so I didn't do a sketch) Colouring, Shading, and fixing any mistake I could find: rest of the time. description: This is to the contribute to DevianrArts 17 Birthday art challenge in 2017! Journal, rules, and submition can be found here: heidi.deviantart.com/journal/C… The rules are simple: Download the template here: www.da-files.com/creative/2017… The 17th Birthday Scribble Challenge is open to all DeviantArt members. Submit as many scribble templates as you’d like. Use the deviation description to tag other deviants you want to participate in the Scribble Challenge. All submissions must adhere to DeviantArt’s normal Terms of Service and Etiquette standards.(I didn't really want to put too much time into this drawing due to how many commissions I have to finish...so I finished this in about 4 hours) I couldn't help but think of frisk for the figure head lines, and Gaster's hands for, well, the hands! I had a hard time trying to fit other Undertale characters into the other lines, but after looking at images of them for a while, I remembered Gaster's Followers! Perfect fit! That 'butterfly' figure was a pain to figure out what to do with it, but the heart locket was best suited for it's heart-shape. At first, it was going to be 2 souls, but I like the locket better. Overall, it looks like Frisk had fun with Gaster and his followers. I'm glad that it didn't turn out to be a tormenting feel with all of them around Frisk. And look at who's at the door waiting for Frisk, Sans! I hope everyone likes it. All of my watchers are my tags!! Go give this challenge a try! It's fun! All drawn free handed using a Wacom pen and tablet on PS CS5. Undertale belongs to Toby Fox.

description: STOP THE FIST!! STOP THE PAIN!!! STOP THE SHARP TONGUE!!!! STOP THE ABUSE!!!!! STOP THE SUFFERING!!!! STAND UP AGAINST THE COLD HEARTS!!!! STAND UP FOR SOMEBODY!!! MEND THEIR BROKEN HEART! ~ STOP BULLYING!!!!!!! STOP THE BULLY!!!! ______ Just thought I'd contribute and raise the awareness that this shit happens. It pisses me off that people do this; dehumanization, heartlessness, hate, intolerance, inflicting pain. Seeing kids with empty faces while their eyes scream in distress and suffering. The hopelessness... the bruises, the blood. Their death in the newspaper and on TV. Bullying doesn't have to be physical but mental too. The kid may give you a stonewall face but his eyes will speak and waver and show you his/her heart is broken. if you see the bullying take place.... bah, punch his face! Some people deserve a smack. And THEN tell a person of authority. The people who witness these acts and do nothing also need a punch cuz, to me, they're just as bad for not giving a shit. THATS how I feel about it. Okay for the sake of being serious, don't punch the bully but tell somebody, like the teacher, principal, security, etc., to reprimand them. And pull the victim to the mall with you and buy him/her dinner. But if you don't like them to help them because of some stupid reason like they're gay, then you need a punch too. edit: Cleaned up the sketch lines a little, but not by much. I still wanted to keep it rough. This is now a PRINT for sizes ranging from 8x10- 16x20! Oh there's that 25% off you guys get. So they're really cheap!

description: It's already been a tradition to send out my own Christmas cards for a few years now. I started in 2005, so this would be my fourth card. Previous cards featured my characters from Trio Solution and yours truly. This year, I thought it was about time to go with something a little bit more generic. The obvious choice was Santa Claus, the generic personification of the holiday season. Sure, I could had done something with Jesus or something, but I'm sure that some of the recipients would be kind of weided out, to say at least. I started out with Santa as a UPS delivery man, but I just couldn't get it right. After a few tries, I decided to try a different angle and thought "instead of making him lame, why not make him awesome". So I did. If you're in some last-minute need of Christmas cards, this is available as a print.

Beautiful Horn, Lovely and strong. Bless us now the heart belong To the hold of Abathia's horn Bright and Strong, moon born Bring the Dreams to Life and Song Take us now, love undone. ********* You slip the soft purple deerskin case from the bag. Inside you feel the lightweight traveling size book. It is neatly wrapped in the waterproof leather. It is held closed with a stunning amethyst clasp with a silver unicorn buckle. Loosening the buckle, you allow the case to fall from the beautiful book. The book is a fine and well-crafted. Bound in gleaming white leather and adorned with a silver unicorn on the cover, it displays the script "Tirael Nimara" in the delicate script of the elves. You softly open the book, inside, you see the perfect, measured writing of a trained hand. Soon, you begin to read....... ******************** Light. Blindness. Soon, the light spreads its wings from my sight and I find myself in strange yet beautiful surroundings. I am pale and nude, wavering in a moonlight path, open only on one end. I feel as though I am only a simple observer in my own body. To either side of the path, lies thick tangled bramble and huge darkened trees. Farther down the wandering path is a large open area filled with pale moonlight which is guarded by a unicorn archway. On either side of the opening rear two unicorn stallions crafted of white marble. They have delicately crafted marble wings lifted and spread to make an archway into the glade. Their alicorns are crossed and are balancing a pentagram between the horn’s points. I feel so safe and serene that I am aghast with joy. I pass under the shelter of the unicorn’s arch. Inside the magnificent glade I gasp in joy. Ethereal light, pale and multihued, dances in the huge spreading treetops above. The sound of tumbling water tickles my ears. I smell the joyous scent of flowers. I know despite my nudity, I can feel no vulnerability in this place. There are motes of light in all different colors, lights and shades that dart and dance within my reach. Purple, blue, black and red flowers of all hues glow from the ground, bushes and trees. The peacefulness of this realm permeates me. I walk over to the tumbling water fall. I see it is pouring into a clear, sparkling lake. The bushes are laden with many colored flowers that hug the sides of the water. Lichen and mosses drip from the overhanging tress and willows, their trailings dancing long the surface of water. Inside the water, tiny multicolored fish, frogs, lizards and fairies dart for deeper water. The water ripples to the other side. A flash of light draws my attention. I stare in awe as I see a shimmering white unicorn walk from the brush. She doesn’t seem to acknowledge me. She walks into the water, her body moving into the lake. She stops. She lowers the shining horn into the water and it begins to ripple as silver streaks stream from her horn. It is a great mare with a flowing silver-blue mane, glistening violet horn and sharp cloven hooves. She was more beautiful than any other horse I had ever seen. From her back were shining iridescent wings. Each feather looked like spun silver, it was so delicate and perfect. It was wonderful. I was so happy! Then she approached me. It moved its wings over my back, hugging me. It was so splendid! Then it told me that I would always be one with Unicorn. Then the unicorn lowered her sharp horn to my heart and she pressed the sparkling shaft to me. I felt the most powerful energy flow into me. I gasped in pleasure as the power coursed and doubled into my body. I could barely maintain my balance. Suddenly, the unicorn took a step back. Then she rose a little, drawing the alicorn to my forehead. I gasped at the exquisite rippling of pleasure bursting within. Then she drew herself back. Spiraling from where my forehead was touched by her horn, my own horn grew in response!!! I was shocked and could do no more than stand there still as a statue. Suddenly the unicorn flared out her wings and the tips of her feathers tingled along my back. My spine flared with energy. She moved her wings away from my back. Pleasure streamed from me as my own feathers were following his! I had wings!! Oh my Unicorn! She then took a step back. I was in shock! Here I stood with my own shining white-violet horn. My own wings spread out beside me! It was so amazing. Then the unicorn looked down at me. She softly said “I am with you. You can always call upon me and my allies for help and guidance. You should always look to us for help.” The unicorn took a step back and she trumpeted a great whinny that echoed for miles. From all areas I saw a menagerie of horses, unicorns, deer, elk, dogs, cats, pegasi and more animals than I could possibly name or know. The area was filled with their energy. A glowing blue light filled the area and I knew…for once…that the blessings of the unicorn were with me. When I awoke I still felt the power of the animals surging within me. I know that the Unicorn was blessing me because of the crystalline, milky violet horn on my forehead and the tumbling white hair. My hair had quite literally turned white! Art Creation Notes: Year Completed: 2009 (Pencil sketch done in 2006) Time it Took: Pencil took several hours, I think three or four devoted hours then a few scattered throughout. Medium: Pencil Original Size: 8x10Inches (YES IT IS VERY SMALL, I regret this, because the unicorn and moon dominate the entire piece of paper. As it was, It was a lot of detail for so small an area. And Abathia, as a unicorn, was not made to regret, so she doesn't mind the small format *hehe, dorky Last Unicorn joke*) Source/Model: No Source Notes: I wanted a good picture for a role playing game god. I use her in D&D. OK. So, this is a colored version of pegacorna2.deviantart.com/art/… that has been completed. Hehe. You know, I only sign a piece I feel is completely and utterly finished. This piece was laying around unsigned for years. I knew I wanted to do the back wing, but I never throught I was ready. My coloring skills have pretty much been to build up to this one. Drawn in pencil, here is the WIP Pencil sketch: pegacorna2.deviantart.com/art/… and I then colored it in prismacolor marker and pencil. The markers gave a really soft watercolored effect and the pencil really makes the picture "pop" I got the purplish prismatic color by layering colors then going over the whole thing with a white colored pencil. No marker was used on Abathia herself, only on the background. Other Pictures of Abathia: :thumb695689158: STEPHANIE SMALL ARTIST AND ACTRESS stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com * Clip Clop Workshop WITH YOU I FELT THE TIDE: Poetry and Fantasy Art, an E-Book Artist Info Commission Info * Contest Info Trades/Gifts to Me! * Trades/Gifts from Me! This is your personal invitation to enjoy a tour through the magical and mundane. See a breathtaking visual tour of ancient times and lands filled with trees, magical mushrooms, foliage, enchanted animals and awesome wizards. Let the splendor of unicorns, dragons, griffins, fairies, horses, the winged horse, Pegasus, and even the lone wolf lure you into a world of artistic exploration. Jump into a magical world! There is something beyond fantasy here. This is a mystical land just for you. If you like something real or mundane, Stephanie creates stunning domestic and wild animals. She studies biology and has a love of the ocean and wild animals. Horses, wolves, foxes, ponies, deer, dogs, cats, panthers, lions, fish, tigers and other creatures are some of the animals she draws. She has done animal pet portraits and is available for commission by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for more information. Stephanie can be commissioned to do custom artwork including portraits of people, animals, homes or whatever your imagination can devise. description: Well, it took quite a while, but here it is! My contribution to deviantart's 17th birthday! Golly, it's almost as old as I am. Feels just like last month when we all did the 16th birthday pictures. Anyway, I decided to do Dark Abbie for this one, and went crazy with the shading. Perhaps she's showing a demonstration of her cosmic, otherworldly powers that came from the Dark Star within her. I hope you all like it! Comments are well appreciated! Dark Abbie (c) BabyAbbieStar

As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- My submission for the Odyssey II Project prologue (runner up). I emphasized what was to me the most interesting part of the prologue, which was, Paul's sense of the people on the train watching and judging him, and not knowing how to behave under the (falsely perceived? or not?) scrutiny. A sense of foreboding; bad things to come. What a surreal episode to have experienced. Is there something wrong with London, or is it with Paul? Anyway, those were my own thoughts. ----- Chapter 1 [link] (winner) Chapter 2 [link] (runner up) Chapter 3 [link] (runner up) Chapter 4 [link] Chapter 5 [link] (runner up) Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] (runner up) Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

description: Attention Odyssey Project mods! If you need this image in a larger size, please let me know! As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- Paul staggered out into the early morning fog like a drunkard. He hunched into the raised lapels of this too-thin jacket and wandered away from the hotel, disoriented, shivering--panic gnawing at his gut like a cannibal. "I need help," he thought, "but where?" Submission for Odyssey II project chapter 2 (runner up). I recognize this is a weaker piece for me, but even so, I'm glad I got it done. I think it was good practice to draw some buildings. That's something I need to do more. Oh, incidentally, I am doing all my chapter art with acrylic ink. I haven't done much with ink in ages and it reminds me how nice it is sometimes to work in. Painter, my usual digital program, has some amazing effects, but there's some things that you really can only do with the real media. I think I missed having ink under my fingernails. ----- Prologue [link] (runner up) Chapter 1 [link] (winner) Chapter 3 [link] (runner up) Chapter 4 [link] Chapter 5 [link] (runner up) Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] (runner up) Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

description: STEPHANIE SMALL ARTIST AND ACTRESS stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com * Clip Clop Workshop WITH YOU I FELT THE TIDE: Poetry and Fantasy Art, an E-Book Artist Info Commission Info * Contest Info Trades/Gifts to Me! * Trades/Gifts from Me! Tir'Rielle Island HorseArt Stable D&D Gygaxian Steed * Eclipquines Disciplines My WolfArt-RPG * My CatArt * My Hybrids TIR'RIELLE ISLAND HORSEART STABLE | Tir'Rielle Island HORSEART Journal | Breeding Studs and Stallions | Broodmares | All Male Equines (Includes Sterile) | All Female Equines (Includes Sterile) | My HORSEART Breeding Gallery | All Breeding Pictures & Foals (Faves) MY HORSEART BREED GALLERIES Gygaxian Steed Gygaxian Steed Breed Sheet (Breed Creators/Owners: Shayla-Estate, StephanieSmall) Eclipquines Eclipquine Breed Sheet (Breed Creators/Owners: Jakedau,Help-4-homles-frends,StephanieSmall) Prisma Paint Prisma Paint Breed Sheet (Breed Creator: DancingDragonStables Breed Owner: StephanieSmall) HORSEART SISTER GAMES Tir'Rielle Island Feline Sanctuary CatArt RPG | Tir'Rielle Wolf Sanctuary WolfArt-RPG Journal | Tir'Rielle Wolf Sanctuary WolfArt-RPG Gallery | My Hybrid Art Game Journal | My Hybrid Art Game Gallery OTHER BREEDS Felshae Shapeshifting Winged Cats ARTIST BIOGRAPHY The Art of Stephanie Small is a complex blend of mythical and real. This is your personal invitation to enjoy a tour through the magical and mundane. See a breathtaking visual tour of ancient times and lands filled with trees, magical mushrooms, foliage, enchanted animals and awesome wizards. Let the splendor of unicorns, dragons, griffins, fairies, horses, the winged horse, Pegasus, and even the lone wolf lure you into a world of artistic exploration. Jump into a magical world! There is something beyond fantasy here. This is a mystical land just for you. If you like something real or mundane, Stephanie creates stunning domestic and wild animals. She studies biology and has a love of the ocean and wild animals. Horses, wolves, foxes, ponies, deer, dogs, cats, panthers, lions, fish, tigers and other creatures are some of the animals she draws. She has done animal pet portraits and is available for commission by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for more information. Stephanie can be commissioned to do custom artwork including portraits of people, animals, homes or whatever your imagination can devise. She can do custom art as you as a pixie, fairy (faery) or mermaid too! Did you ever want to see yourself as a manga or anime character? Stephanie will do that! She can be commissioned to create a magical portrait of you! Stephanie creates art that features unicorns, mermaids, dragons, griffons and whatever fits her fancy. She can create cute, custom art for you that can be placed on a variety of Zazzle products such as Tshirts, blankets and more. Are you wanting your pet or child drawn? Want their picture on a blanket? Email Stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for details. Stephanie Small is an artist located in California but she has spent time all over Oregon. Nature is an influential inspiration to Stephanie, as she seeks to augment and reflect what she sees around her in a variety of mediums. Inspired by medieval art, the fantasy and science fiction genre and more, Stephanie has developed a style of mythical realism. Stephanie uses a variety of styles and mixed mediums in her artwork. She regularly uses digital mediums such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Painter and more. She favors traditional mediums such as colored pencil, chalk, pen, ink, pencil, acrylic, watercolor. She has been known to adapt fabric, recycled art, recycled purses to create art that is both useful and stylish. Stephanie has been interviewed and featured in several magazines and websites. Her artwork has been published several times in books and magazines. She is best known for artwork featured in publications such as the Page, the Twisted Vine, the Unicorn and others. Her artwork will be featured on the cover of several upcoming books and publications. She often donates teaching, administrative assistance, research and artwork to many local non-profits. She has taught in-person and online classes on food preservation, writing, gardening, spirituality, unicorns, art and more. She has worked for (and with) the local government to initiate youth projects, senior events and business support. Stephanie loves unicorns and the horses she grew up with. It is clear in her art. She also loves mermaids. She even has a set of mermaid fins she can swim in. Stephanie Small finds inspiration in the animals of the ocean such as whales, orcas, narwhals and dolphins. Whether you are looking for a gift for girls, boys, men or women or whatever someone identify with, you will find something for everyone. Powerful images which have themes such as cute, goth, fantasy, wild animals, patterns, geometric designs, sacred symbols, pentagrams, realistic or more can all be commissioned and area available in current gallery images. Her products have been featured in pagan groups and wicca organizations. She embraces a variety of colors, favoring jewel tones (red, blue, green, purple) as well as more outgoing colors such as orange, yellow, pink, teal, green, violet or lavender, white and more. She provides many steampunk, medieval fantasy, black and gothic or cute anime and manga themed products. She is in the Society for Creative Anachronism ( SCA ) and is a member of the Vallejo Oddfellows as well as other non-profits. She has a veterinary assisting certificate which helps her by giving her a thorough education in anatomy and the natural world. She can also create images that recreate an emotion or event such as happy, sad, depression, love, joy, exhilaration, congratulations, birthday, holiday, Christmas, Halloween, Yule, Easter, Ostara, and whatever other holiday or celebration you can think of! You can purchase her merchandise from Clip Clop Workshop her website. If you are looking for a personalized gift, look no further! These unique and stunning pieces of work are available in a variety of pieces and many can be customized to your preference. Are you expecting? She has a bunch of great baby gifts available. You can find personalized wedding gifts, Christmas presents and stuff for him and for her! Looking for something for kids, well this art is geared to making them squeal with joy! You can find a variety of personalized birthday gifts, photo gifts and products that appeal to anyone! Stephanie has provided high end and unique quality items, as well as some more inexpensive and cheap items to fill stockings! Visit her Store! Many of her pieces are cute and fun. She loves to paint her pictures using a variety of colors, she often blends them together. Highlight of contrasting hues augment a variety of her pieces. Whether your favorite color is red, blue, yellow, pink, green, brown, orange, black or white, there is an image that will fit into your home and apparel desires. Stephanie has prepared a variety of images suitable for any occasion. You can explore her Zazzle page to find pillows, blankets, T-shirts, wooden gift boxes, necklaces, jewelry and clothing. These are available for birthday, Christmas, Yule, Easter, Ostara, Thanksgiving, Halloween, Veteran's Day, Solstices, Equinoxes, Eclipses and other holidays. Stephanie Small is also an actress and you will be able to see her in the upcoming series, 13 Reasons Why and several upcoming major motion pictures. She does voiceover, voiceacting, modeling and can also be hired for these services by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com Clip Clop Workshop: The Art of Stephanie Small and Kaia de Ocampo (married artists who own a motion graphic design company) CLIP CLOP WORK SHOP FACEBOOK CLIP CLOP WORK SHOP TWITTER GOOGLE PLUS LINKEDIN YOUTUBE BLOG CLIP CLOP WORKSHOP STORE (GO HERE TO BUY PRODUCTS OR CLICK ON A LINK BELOW) The Unique-CORN series: Express your inner unicorn (Goth unicorn, Cat Unicorn, Fairy Unicorn, Angel Unicorn and Dragon Unicorn) Magickal and Metaphysical: Spiritual Enlightenment Spiral Essence Unicorn and Griffon with Celtic Knot: Magickal Unicorn Moon Series: Bestselling Piece, My icon image Unicorn and Dragon Lovers Eternal Embrace Binders, T-shirts, blankets and more For the Goths: Gothic Fantasy: clothes and home decor Wolves, Dogs and Canines: clothes, blankets and more Griffons: wearable art Cats, Kittens, Panthers, Lions, Tigers and felines: blankets, pillows, T-shirts, cards and more Gift Ideas for all ages: and greeting cards too! description: Attention Odyssey Project mods! If you need this image in a larger size, please let me know! As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- Paul's eyes danced from side to side, his head was splitting, sweat was dripping down his neck and face, everything was hot and cold, everything hurt with a screaming pain, but he couldn't seem to make his mouth move to do it. Submission for Odyssey Project II chapter 5 (runner up). Just about ran out of time on this one. Had a super busy and stressful week and couldn't even come up with an interesting concept drawing till yesterday. So it's a bit rough, but I'm just glad to have been able to get something done by the deadline. While I was drawing and painting this, the tentacle eyestalk whatever things seemed to look less like tentacle eyestalk whatever things and more like the branches of some deranged tree. I started think about the Fountain movie and the story with the god who died and created the world when his body turned into a tree, and I started to think about the biblical tree of knowledge, and other things like that. I wonder what will happen to Paul, I wonder how this story will end, and if someone will think of something creative. Acrylic ink. ----- Prologue [link] (runner up) Chapter 1 [link] (winner) Chapter 2 [link] (runner up) Chapter 3 [link] (runner up) Chapter 4 [link] Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] (runner up) Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

description: Attention Odyssey Project mods! If you need this image in a larger size, please let me know! As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- Paul worked up a lather in his hands and gently started to wash the rash. Flakes, like scales, began to slough away. Underneath whirled a mass of colors. Indigo. Vermilion. Rust. Mahogany. And they were… moving. Swirling. Copulating with each other. Buds of new, unseen colors exploding from the trysts. It was beautiful. It was obscene. It was spreading. Submission for Odyssey II Project chapter 1 (winner). Color is kind of my kryptonite. I wrecked three sheets of watercolor paper before I finally got one that I liked. I'm having a lot of fun working on these submissions though. It's giving me a chance to do some work in a style I don't get to do much, and I'm remembering how much I liked working with ink and how little of that I do anymore these days. ----- Prologue [link] (runner up) Chapter 2 [link] (runner up) Chapter 3 [link] (runner up) Chapter 4 [link] Chapter 5 [link] (runner up) Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

description: Attention Odyssey Project mods! If you need this image in a larger size, please let me know! As I am selling prints, I have set it to not allow downloads of the large original image! ----- Lysanna felt a sudden change in her breathing, and knew than [sic] that something had happened to her Progeny. Submission for Odyssey Project II chapter 3 (runner up). Super fun to work on this chapter. I actually took some time and really tried to do a proper painting, instead of merely laying down some random color as a background for my lines. Painting and color palette choice are weaknesses for me, which I am aware of. Taking this into consideration, I think I did a good job. Which is why it's a shame that it didn't scan properly... Usually I use hot pressed paper, which has a smooth texture, and it scans beautifully. In fact the scans look better than the originals, I find! But I'm running out of it, so I used cold pressed paper which has a much rougher texture. The rough texture messes with the scanner lights, and it never scans as nicely, no matter what settings I fool around with. A lot of subtle detail gets lost in the scan. And I didn't have the time or motivation or skill to photograph it. Too busy this weekend. I'm hoping that you all still like it. After all, you don't have the original to compare it to! (I see that I suddenly have been given a premium membership for one month, so I am "requesting critique" for this deviation. I welcome critiques on all my work. I miss the in-depth, unflinching crits I used to get while in art school. One detailed explanation of something you don't like and how you would fix it is SO MUCH more useful than a million short "I like this!" comments. Not that I don't appreciate those too, of course. Just feel free to tell me what's not working. How else am I supposed to get better?) Acrylic ink with some corrections made in photoshop. ----- Prologue [link] (runner up) Chapter 1 [link] (winner) Chapter 2 [link] (runner up) Chapter 4 [link] Chapter 5 [link] (runner up) Chapter 6 [link] (winner) Chapter 7 [link] (runner up) Chapter 8 [link] These are all available as prints.

description: Love is real. Love is transcendent. Love is rough. Love is beautiful. Love is passionate. Love is contagious. Love is worth it. Love just is. Happy Spirit Day. Wow! So many faves and views today: this is amazing! I wanted this simple graphic to be effective and captivating, and I'm glad it was. Thank you so much to everyone: for your likes, your views, your comments, and your support for love. If we strive to settle our differences peacefully and positively, and looked beyond prejudices, the world would be a much better place. We can work for it! Happy Spirit Day, everyone. Peace. I am simply stunned by the attention this piece has gotten; even now, I see so many messages telling me someone out there has added this piece to their favourites. Truly appreciated, thank you so much. I've uploaded a higher resolution image and enabled prints now — it can be printed to a very large size. So if anyone would like to have a high-quality poster or canvas print of this work, it's there for you to do so. Enjoy!

description: I dunno if the genre is right- but here's my Realism body of work c: UH, it used to have some painted vegetables involved, but it was kinda ditched because it was half-arsed~ I'll just- copy paste my artist description here : The concept that Ive tried to convey in this artwork is the mental decay thats involved with dementia. The disease is commonly connected to the term of forgetful-ness the disease of the mind. What makes it so destructive is not just that they forget to brush their teeth or when to have dinner- but they forget who they love. I have three grandparents who are suffering from dementia, and Ive watched my parents struggle with dealing with someone who they care for so much; not recall who they are. The subject I have here is my grandmother. I have shown this mental distance by having the head canvas floating further away from her body, her past and physical presence not understood in her present state. Although this is a key aspect of dementia, what I really wanted to show was that in fact, the victim isnt the only one who forgets. Its the people who care about them, too. I know when I was a kid, I used to visit my grandmother once every week; and shed baby sit me when I was sick. Shed read me stories and play card games. Although I know that she used to be the person she was then, all I can remember of her now is what I see now; unstable, unrecognisable and in an almost child-like state. And I feel guilty, for forgetting who she really is. Because all I see now is a physical existence, but not being completely present anymore; not really being my grandmother anymore. I demonstrated this by painting her body onto an actual rocking chair. Although her body is visible, the very person who it depicts is no longer 'real'. Featured: [link] EDIT: Oh gosh, a DD! I'm speechless! Thank you all so much for your support- and I hope that all of you with personal experiences with the disease have things turn out for the best. I wish it were under better circumstances, you all have these stories and I'm so sorry for all of you-- I'm always here to talk about it, if you need to c:

As for the writing on the snowman in blue, well, that's a little something that happened a whole bunch of years ago. description: Sweet Jesus, a DD? Thank you so much! This character design is two years old, though. If you would like to see his new design and be updated on the comic he's in, watch my main account: =temporary-glitch. Thank you so, so much, and Merry Christmas to everyone! Biography Name: Peppermint Nicknames: Santa, Nicholas Eye color: Green Hair color: Red and white Height: 5'5" Companions: Licorice, Truffles, Egg Nogg, Punch, Cider, Candy-Ribbon, Cocoa, Tea, Caramel, Ginger, Cinnamon, Popcorn, Chestnut, Cranberry Occupation: Defender of Christmas and neighboring holidays; annual gift-giver Appearance: Is usually wearing bright, festive colors. His skin is very pale and his cheeks and nose, ears on occasion, are always bright and rosy. He always has his candy cane with him, which he carved himself from a branch of the Ornamin tree. On the very end is a green gemstone his father, the real Santa Claus, gave him to enable teleporation between Earth and Christmas Land. The object that holds the real power, however, is embedded deeply within that stone; a golden star. Somewhere on the giant candy cane is a switch that removes almost all of the top part of the candy cane, save for about two feet from the green gem up, revealing a red and white striped sword. Personality and Accomplishments: He is very happy and charitable, always thinking of others before himself. This attribute makes way for an uncommon selflessness that usually gets Peppermint in trouble. He is very innocent and bright, and is usually managing the toy factory for his father, helping his fellow elves come up with ideas for new toys. He can't keep a grudge--either he confronts someone himself and tries to compromise with them, or he writes them a nice letter, and waits for a reply. Peppermint is currently learning how to be a true Defender of Holiday, but he isn't doing very well, unlike his schoolmates...he seems as though he's far too innocent to fight. He loves Christmas and snow, and can't get enough of that ice-cream stuff. He hates hot and spicy things. Along with his learning, he often aids his father in delivering gifts to the children on Christmas day. The kids that do catch a glimpse of him mistake his pale white chest as a long beard, and his puffy pants as a big belly. How they got all that red in the mix, he just can't seem to figure out. ;3 --- *Pant koff.* I caught myself a lovely cold in the making of this image...and maybe now my cold will go away, and I can work on commissions and art trade halves and everything else I piled up on myself! Anyway, this is what my icon and journal header were made from...the new-and-improved design of the little Christmas angel, Peppermint. More designs are soon to come, like Licorice and Punch and the gang! Also, I'll make a comparison picture tomorrow. Once I sleep. *Goes and dies.* Sketched with a col-erase red pencil on sketchbook paper. Then scanned and inked in Photoshop CS2, and colored in openCanvas 3.03E Plus!. Circles and border were also added in Photoshop CS2. Peppermint and image(c) me. Please do not copy, steal, or redistribute.

description: Graphic Design project #2 is a protest poster. Its not due for another week, but I managed to finish it in 2 days. Mainly because I have no life, but also because I really enjoyed this project. I chose to make a protest/motivational poster, depending on your point of view. If you're going to a Gay pride march, this can be a motivational poster. If you're marching in front of anti-gay activists, then its a protest poster. If you don't know, its Dr. Frank-N-Furter, the amazing Transvestite from The Rocky Horror Picture Show. I chose him to be the LGBT's presidential candidate for this parody on the Obama Pride poster. Fitting. Click download for the full-sized, 2'x3' poster. Print it out and use it if you'd like! UPDATE: I've been getting messages regarding wether or not this image can be used in this blog/that magazine/ my website/ etc. I don't really check my messages here very often, and if you desperately want to display this on one of the above places (or any I left out), please feel free. Do NOT feel free to claim it as your own, as I will nut you if you do. But seriously, this image is telling a message, and that message should be available freely. Basically, from here on out, you don't need to ask permission to use this for non commercial purposes, unless specifically crediting me as the original artist. Thank you all for the wonderful feedback and love for this image!

This is your personal invitation to enjoy a tour through the magical and mundane. See a breathtaking visual tour of ancient times and lands filled with trees, magical mushrooms, foliage, enchanted animals and awesome wizards. Let the splendor of unicorns, dragons, griffins, fairies, horses, the winged horse, Pegasus, and even the lone wolf lure you into a world of artistic exploration. Jump into a magical world! There is something beyond fantasy here. This is a mystical land just for you. If you like something real or mundane, Stephanie creates stunning domestic and wild animals. She studies biology and has a love of the ocean and wild animals. Horses, wolves, foxes, ponies, deer, dogs, cats, panthers, lions, fish, tigers and other creatures are some of the animals she draws. She has done animal pet portraits and is available for commission by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for more information. Stephanie can be commissioned to do custom artwork including portraits of people, animals, homes or whatever your imagination can devise. She can do custom art as you as a pixie, fairy (faery) or mermaid too! Did you ever want to see yourself as a manga or anime character? Stephanie will do that! She can be commissioned to create a magical portrait of you! Stephanie creates art that features unicorns, mermaids, dragons, griffons and whatever fits her fancy. She can create cute, custom art for you that can be placed on a variety of Zazzle products such as Tshirts, blankets and more. Are you wanting your pet or child drawn? Want their picture on a blanket? Email Stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for details. Stephanie Small is an artist located in California but she has spent time all over Oregon. Nature is an influential inspiration to Stephanie, as she seeks to augment and reflect what she sees around her in a variety of mediums. Inspired by medieval art, the fantasy and science fiction genre and more, Stephanie has developed a style of mythical realism. Stephanie uses a variety of styles and mixed mediums in her artwork. She regularly uses digital mediums such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Painter and more. She favors traditional mediums such as colored pencil, chalk, pen, ink, pencil, acrylic, watercolor. She has been known to adapt fabric, recycled art, recycled purses to create art that is both useful and stylish. Stephanie has been interviewed and featured in several magazines and websites. Her artwork has been published several times in books and magazines. She is best known for artwork featured in publications such as the Page, the Twisted Vine, the Unicorn and others. Her artwork will be featured on the cover of several upcoming books and publications. She often donates teaching, administrative assistance, research and artwork to many local non-profits. She has taught in-person and online classes on food preservation, writing, gardening, spirituality, unicorns, art and more. She has worked for (and with) the local government to initiate youth projects, senior events and business support. Stephanie loves unicorns and the horses she grew up with. It is clear in her art. She also loves mermaids. She even has a set of mermaid fins she can swim in. Stephanie Small finds inspiration in the animals of the ocean such as whales, orcas, narwhals and dolphins. Whether you are looking for a gift for girls, boys, men or women or whatever someone identify with, you will find something for everyone. Powerful images which have themes such as cute, goth, fantasy, wild animals, patterns, geometric designs, sacred symbols, pentagrams, realistic or more can all be commissioned and area available in current gallery images. Her products have been featured in pagan groups and wicca organizations. She embraces a variety of colors, favoring jewel tones (red, blue, green, purple) as well as more outgoing colors such as orange, yellow, pink, teal, green, violet or lavender, white and more. She provides many steampunk, medieval fantasy, black and gothic or cute anime and manga themed products. She is in the Society for Creative Anachronism ( SCA ) and is a member of the Vallejo Oddfellows as well as other non-profits. She has a veterinary assisting certificate which helps her by giving her a thorough education in anatomy and the natural world. She can also create images that recreate an emotion or event such as happy, sad, depression, love, joy, exhilaration, congratulations, birthday, holiday, Christmas, Halloween, Yule, Easter, Ostara, and whatever other holiday or celebration you can think of! You can purchase her merchandise from Clip Clop Workshop her website. If you are looking for a personalized gift, look no further! These unique and stunning pieces of work are available in a variety of pieces and many can be customized to your preference. Are you expecting? She has a bunch of great baby gifts available. You can find personalized wedding gifts, Christmas presents and stuff for him and for her! Looking for something for kids, well this art is geared to making them squeal with joy! You can find a variety of personalized birthday gifts, photo gifts and products that appeal to anyone! Stephanie has provided high end and unique quality items, as well as some more inexpensive and cheap items to fill stockings! Visit her Store! Many of her pieces are cute and fun. She loves to paint her pictures using a variety of colors, she often blends them together. Highlight of contrasting hues augment a variety of her pieces. Whether your favorite color is red, blue, yellow, pink, green, brown, orange, black or white, there is an image that will fit into your home and apparel desires. Stephanie has prepared a variety of images suitable for any occasion. You can explore her Zazzle page to find pillows, blankets, T-shirts, wooden gift boxes, necklaces, jewelry and clothing. These are available for birthday, Christmas, Yule, Easter, Ostara, Thanksgiving, Halloween, Veteran's Day, Solstices, Equinoxes, Eclipses and other holidays. Stephanie Small is also an actress and you will be able to see her in the upcoming series, 13 Reasons Why and several upcoming major motion pictures. See a breathtaking visual tour of ancient times and lands filled with trees, magical mushrooms, foliage, enchanted animals and awesome wizards. Let the splendor of unicorns, dragons, griffins, fairies, horses, the winged horse, Pegasus, and even the lone wolf lure you into a world of artistic exploration. Jump into a magical world! There is something beyond fantasy here. This is a mystical land just for you. If you like something real or mundane, Stephanie creates stunning domestic and wild animals. She studies biology and has a love of the ocean and wild animals. Horses, wolves, foxes, ponies, deer, dogs, cats, panthers, lions, fish, tigers and other creatures are some of the animals she draws. She has done animal pet portraits and is available for commission by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for more information. Stephanie can be commissioned to do custom artwork including portraits of people, animals, homes or whatever your imagination can devise. She can do custom art as you as a pixie, fairy (faery) or mermaid too! Did you ever want to see yourself as a manga or anime character? Stephanie will do that! She can be commissioned to create a magical portrait of you! Stephanie creates art that features unicorns, mermaids, dragons, griffons and whatever fits her fancy. She can create cute, custom art for you that can be placed on a variety of Zazzle products such as Tshirts, blankets and more. Are you wanting your pet or child drawn? Want their picture on a blanket? Email Stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for details. Stephanie Small is an artist located in California but she has spent time all over Oregon. Nature is an influential inspiration to Stephanie, as she seeks to augment and reflect what she sees around her in a variety of mediums. Inspired by medieval art, the fantasy and science fiction genre and more, Stephanie has developed a style of mythical realism. Stephanie uses a variety of styles and mixed mediums in her artwork. She regularly uses digital mediums such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Painter and more. She favors traditional mediums such as colored pencil, chalk, pen, ink, pencil, acrylic, watercolor. She has been known to adapt fabric, recycled art, recycled purses to create art that is both useful and stylish. Stephanie has been interviewed and featured in several magazines and websites. Her artwork has been published several times in books and magazines. She is best known for artwork featured in publications such as the Page, the Twisted Vine, the Unicorn and others. Her artwork will be featured on the cover of several upcoming books and publications. She often donates teaching, administrative assistance, research and artwork to many local non-profits. She has taught in-person and online classes on food preservation, writing, gardening, spirituality, unicorns, art and more. She has worked for (and with) the local government to initiate youth projects, senior events and business support. Stephanie loves unicorns and the horses she grew up with. It is clear in her art. She also loves mermaids. She even has a set of mermaid fins she can swim in. Stephanie Small finds inspiration in the animals of the ocean such as whales, orcas, narwhals and dolphins. Whether you are looking for a gift for girls, boys, men or women or whatever someone identify with, you will find something for everyone. Powerful images which have themes such as cute, goth, fantasy, wild animals, patterns, geometric designs, sacred symbols, pentagrams, realistic or more can all be commissioned and area available in current gallery images. Her products have been featured in pagan groups and wicca organizations. She embraces a variety of colors, favoring jewel tones (red, blue, green, purple) as well as more outgoing colors such as orange, yellow, pink, teal, green, violet or lavender, white and more. She provides many steampunk, medieval fantasy, black and gothic or cute anime and manga themed products. She is in the Society for Creative Anachronism ( SCA ) and is a member of the Vallejo Oddfellows as well as other non-profits. She has a veterinary assisting certificate which helps her by giving her a thorough education in anatomy and the natural world. She can also create images that recreate an emotion or event such as happy, sad, depression, love, joy, exhilaration, congratulations, birthday, holiday, Christmas, Halloween, Yule, Easter, Ostara, and whatever other holiday or celebration you can think of! You can purchase her merchandise from Clip Clop Workshop her website. If you are looking for a personalized gift, look no further! These unique and stunning pieces of work are available in a variety of pieces and many can be customized to your preference. Are you expecting? She has a bunch of great baby gifts available. You can find personalized wedding gifts, Christmas presents and stuff for him and for her! Looking for something for kids, well this art is geared to making them squeal with joy! You can find a variety of personalized birthday gifts, photo gifts and products that appeal to anyone! Stephanie has provided high end and unique quality items, as well as some more inexpensive and cheap items to fill stockings! Visit her Store! Many of her pieces are cute and fun. She loves to paint her pictures using a variety of colors, she often blends them together. Highlight of contrasting hues augment a variety of her pieces. Whether your favorite color is red, blue, yellow, pink, green, brown, orange, black or white, there is an image that will fit into your home and apparel desires. Stephanie has prepared a variety of images suitable for any occasion. You can explore her Zazzle page to find pillows, blankets, T-shirts, wooden gift boxes, necklaces, jewelry and clothing. These are available for birthday, Christmas, Yule, Easter, Ostara, Thanksgiving, Halloween, Veteran's Day, Solstices, Equinoxes, Eclipses and other holidays. Stephanie Small is also an actress and you will be able to see her in the upcoming series, 13 Reasons Why and several upcoming major motion pictures. He's barely a month old, has a huuuge worm or fart belly and a voice you can hear all the way till Lebanon. Needless to say, my other cats are not amused.

description: If you like what you see, commission me. I managed to get it done in time! Huzzah! HAPPY VALENTINE'S EVERYBODY! And of course, who better to represent love than Princess Mi Amore Cadenza, aka Cadence, and her hubby, Prince Shining Armor from My Little Pony. This is for 's Valentine Exchange. I wanted to do this for Valentine's Day anyway, so it worked out. I like using unusual colors for traditional holidays; my Holiday cards rarely have red and green in them, and for the Holiday of Love I thought it would be nice to do something that WASN'T red or pink. Though, Cadence is pink by definition... ah well. For the piece itself I tried to use a heart motif, subtly, in the shapes of their hair and necks, eyes, etc. Also I wanted everything to be as soft as possible in terms of shading, expression, and magic. Hope you enjoy "everypony"! As always, let me know what you think.

description: This was the first project I completed completely on Adobe Illustrator CC! I know its a pretty small step towards becoming a professional commercial illustrator, but it was still quite exciting. Anyways, you probably recognize the character in my drawing from a fairly popular British TV series called Sherlock. This is actually a recreation of a scene form the first episode, "Study in Pink", hence the pink color palette. I made each line using the pencil tool, making me learn line width and brush definition very quickly... sink or swim. In the end I'm very happy with this project, even if it's only a recreation. (c) BBC Original Image If your interested in requesting a commission, just go to the profile page of my account, and scroll down to "commissions" for commission info.

description: I woke up today and upon opening DA found out about this amazing challenge. It took me 2 hours to put together a piece I'm not ashamed of posting . It seems that the marines are having some kind of trouble in bay 17! Oh noez! This picture took me completely out of my comfort zone, I like to carefully brood and think over every picture, every spot and every angle, which takes me a lot of time. Here I tried to be quick and precise, I hope I haven't failed. And.. of course if you look closely all the template pieces are in place , although they might be covered in Xenomorph drool.

description: STEPHANIE SMALL ARTIST AND ACTRESS stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com * Clip Clop Workshop WITH YOU I FELT THE TIDE: Poetry and Fantasy Art, an E-Book Artist Info Commission Info * Contest Info Trades/Gifts to Me! * Trades/Gifts from Me! Tir'Rielle Island HorseArt Stable D&D Gygaxian Steed * Eclipquines Disciplines My WolfArt-RPG * My CatArt * My Hybrids TIR'RIELLE ISLAND HORSEART STABLE | Tir'Rielle Island HORSEART Journal | Breeding Studs and Stallions | Broodmares | All Male Equines (Includes Sterile) | All Female Equines (Includes Sterile) | My HORSEART Breeding Gallery | All Breeding Pictures & Foals (Faves) MY HORSEART BREED GALLERIES Gygaxian Steed Gygaxian Steed Breed Sheet (Breed Creators/Owners: Shayla-Estate, StephanieSmall) Eclipquines Eclipquine Breed Sheet (Breed Creators/Owners: Jakedau,Help-4-homles-frends,StephanieSmall) Prisma Paint Prisma Paint Breed Sheet (Breed Creator: DancingDragonStables Breed Owner: StephanieSmall) HORSEART SISTER GAMES Tir'Rielle Island Feline Sanctuary CatArt RPG | Tir'Rielle Wolf Sanctuary WolfArt-RPG Journal | Tir'Rielle Wolf Sanctuary WolfArt-RPG Gallery | My Hybrid Art Game Journal | My Hybrid Art Game Gallery OTHER BREEDS Felshae Shapeshifting Winged Cats ARTIST BIOGRAPHY The Art of Stephanie Small is a complex blend of mythical and real. This is your personal invitation to enjoy a tour through the magical and mundane. See a breathtaking visual tour of ancient times and lands filled with trees, magical mushrooms, foliage, enchanted animals and awesome wizards. Let the splendor of unicorns, dragons, griffins, fairies, horses, the winged horse, Pegasus, and even the lone wolf lure you into a world of artistic exploration. Jump into a magical world! There is something beyond fantasy here. This is a mystical land just for you. If you like something real or mundane, Stephanie creates stunning domestic and wild animals. She studies biology and has a love of the ocean and wild animals. Horses, wolves, foxes, ponies, deer, dogs, cats, panthers, lions, fish, tigers and other creatures are some of the animals she draws. She has done animal pet portraits and is available for commission by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for more information. Stephanie can be commissioned to do custom artwork including portraits of people, animals, homes or whatever your imagination can devise. She can do custom art as you as a pixie, fairy (faery) or mermaid too! Did you ever want to see yourself as a manga or anime character? Stephanie will do that! She can be commissioned to create a magical portrait of you! Stephanie creates art that features unicorns, mermaids, dragons, griffons and whatever fits her fancy. She can create cute, custom art for you that can be placed on a variety of Zazzle products such as Tshirts, blankets and more. Are you wanting your pet or child drawn? Want their picture on a blanket? Email Stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com for details. Stephanie Small is an artist located in California but she has spent time all over Oregon. Nature is an influential inspiration to Stephanie, as she seeks to augment and reflect what she sees around her in a variety of mediums. Inspired by medieval art, the fantasy and science fiction genre and more, Stephanie has developed a style of mythical realism. Stephanie uses a variety of styles and mixed mediums in her artwork. She regularly uses digital mediums such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Painter and more. She favors traditional mediums such as colored pencil, chalk, pen, ink, pencil, acrylic, watercolor. She has been known to adapt fabric, recycled art, recycled purses to create art that is both useful and stylish. Stephanie has been interviewed and featured in several magazines and websites. Her artwork has been published several times in books and magazines. She is best known for artwork featured in publications such as the Page, the Twisted Vine, the Unicorn and others. Her artwork will be featured on the cover of several upcoming books and publications. She often donates teaching, administrative assistance, research and artwork to many local non-profits. She has taught in-person and online classes on food preservation, writing, gardening, spirituality, unicorns, art and more. She has worked for (and with) the local government to initiate youth projects, senior events and business support. Stephanie loves unicorns and the horses she grew up with. It is clear in her art. She also loves mermaids. She even has a set of mermaid fins she can swim in. Stephanie Small finds inspiration in the animals of the ocean such as whales, orcas, narwhals and dolphins. Whether you are looking for a gift for girls, boys, men or women or whatever someone identify with, you will find something for everyone. Powerful images which have themes such as cute, goth, fantasy, wild animals, patterns, geometric designs, sacred symbols, pentagrams, realistic or more can all be commissioned and area available in current gallery images. Her products have been featured in pagan groups and wicca organizations. She embraces a variety of colors, favoring jewel tones (red, blue, green, purple) as well as more outgoing colors such as orange, yellow, pink, teal, green, violet or lavender, white and more. She provides many steampunk, medieval fantasy, black and gothic or cute anime and manga themed products. She is in the Society for Creative Anachronism ( SCA ) and is a member of the Vallejo Oddfellows as well as other non-profits. She has a veterinary assisting certificate which helps her by giving her a thorough education in anatomy and the natural world. She can also create images that recreate an emotion or event such as happy, sad, depression, love, joy, exhilaration, congratulations, birthday, holiday, Christmas, Halloween, Yule, Easter, Ostara, and whatever other holiday or celebration you can think of! You can purchase her merchandise from Clip Clop Workshop her website. If you are looking for a personalized gift, look no further! These unique and stunning pieces of work are available in a variety of pieces and many can be customized to your preference. Are you expecting? She has a bunch of great baby gifts available. You can find personalized wedding gifts, Christmas presents and stuff for him and for her! Looking for something for kids, well this art is geared to making them squeal with joy! You can find a variety of personalized birthday gifts, photo gifts and products that appeal to anyone! Stephanie has provided high end and unique quality items, as well as some more inexpensive and cheap items to fill stockings! Visit her Store! Many of her pieces are cute and fun. She loves to paint her pictures using a variety of colors, she often blends them together. Highlight of contrasting hues augment a variety of her pieces. Whether your favorite color is red, blue, yellow, pink, green, brown, orange, black or white, there is an image that will fit into your home and apparel desires. Stephanie has prepared a variety of images suitable for any occasion. You can explore her Zazzle page to find pillows, blankets, T-shirts, wooden gift boxes, necklaces, jewelry and clothing. These are available for birthday, Christmas, Yule, Easter, Ostara, Thanksgiving, Halloween, Veteran's Day, Solstices, Equinoxes, Eclipses and other holidays. Stephanie Small is also an actress and you will be able to see her in the upcoming series, 13 Reasons Why and several upcoming major motion pictures. She does voiceover, voiceacting, modeling and can also be hired for these services by emailing stephanie@clipclopworkshop.com Clip Clop Workshop: The Art of Stephanie Small and Kaia de Ocampo (married artists who own a motion graphic design company) CLIP CLOP WORK SHOP FACEBOOK CLIP CLOP WORK SHOP TWITTER GOOGLE PLUS LINKEDIN YOUTUBE BLOG CLIP CLOP WORKSHOP STORE (GO HERE TO BUY PRODUCTS OR CLICK ON A LINK BELOW) The Unique-CORN series: Express your inner unicorn (Goth unicorn, Cat Unicorn, Fairy Unicorn, Angel Unicorn and Dragon Unicorn) Magickal and Metaphysical: Spiritual Enlightenment Spiral Essence Unicorn and Griffon with Celtic Knot: Magickal Unicorn Moon Series: Bestselling Piece, My icon image Unicorn and Dragon Lovers Eternal Embrace Binders, T-shirts, blankets and more For the Goths: Gothic Fantasy: clothes and home decor Wolves, Dogs and Canines: clothes, blankets and more Griffons: wearable art Cats, Kittens, Panthers, Lions, Tigers and felines: blankets, pillows, T-shirts, cards and more Gift Ideas for all ages: and greeting cards too! Wedding and Love: Express your adoration Fantasy Clothes and Gifts: T-Shirts, art and more Dragons and Reptiles: Clothes and home goods Horses, Ponies, Pegasus, Unicorns, Zebras, Donkeys and Other Equines: T-Shirts, clothes and more! I have published an e-book featuring my art and poetry WITH YOU I FELT THE TIDE: Poetry and Fantasy Art, an E-Book

description: Saola. Original Image: x = Evelran Male Saola Rare Wild Animal and twin pictured above. There is one adoptable available. The little baby above. Draw to own. Contact me to reserve. Tehan Soala Male Breedable x Neysadia the Rare Soala Female Breedable Breed: Saola Saola Breed Information and Registry Vu Quang Ox Soala Information and Registry Saola (pronounced Sow-la) are real animals although we do not have any in captivity. Also called Vu Quang ox. This is a rare mammal and it is critically endangered. Only four Saola have been documented in the wild as of today. Often called the Asian Unicorn, this rare and elusive creature is as difficult to find as the creature they are nicknamed after. In May 1992, the Saola was discovered in north-central Vietnam. A unique skull was found in a hunter’s cache. Each Saola (male and female) has two, long straight, 20-inch horns. They are cousins to cattle despite looking like antelope. They have bright, white markings on their face. These rare beings are found only in the Annamite Mountains of Vietnam and Laos. Their name means "spinning wheel posts" and is probably related to the size and shape of the horns. Resources: World Wildlife: https://www.worldwildlife.org/species/saola Soala Booklet Saola (pronounced Sow-la) are real animals although we do not have any in captivity. This is a rare mammal and it is critically endangered. Only four Saola have been documented in the wild as of today. Often called the Asian Unicorn, this rare and elusive creature is as difficult to find as the creature they are nicknamed after. In May 1992, the Saola was discovered in north-central Vietnam. A unique skull was found in a hunter’s cache. Each Saola (male and female) has two, long straight, 20-inch horns. They are cousins to cattle despite looking like antelope. They have noteable white markings on their face. These rare beings are found only in the Annamite Mountains of Vietnam and Laos. Resources: World Wildlife: www.worldwildlife.org/species/… Saola Booklet by WWF: c402277.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/pu… Build: Saola

description: a quick thing i drew for the valentines day exchange 2015 Valentine's Day Art Exchange 2015The Valentine's Day Art Exchange is back! Break out the virtual glitter and cyber candy hearts, and create valentines for your fellow deviants to send to their special someones! DIGITAL LOVE IS IN THE AIR Break out the candy hearts and crafting paper, because the Valentine's Day Art Exchange is back! With Valentine's Day just around the corner, now's the time to create valentines for your fellow deviants to share with their special someones. Take part and help spread the love! Start now by creating a digital valentine to be submitted to the Valentine Exchange category. Then, from February 11th to 16th, deviations in the Valentine Exchange category can be sent as valentines to your friends and loved ones! How It Works <strong> i thought about making more versions with different genders for same-sex couples, but i won't do them because love is love, no matter what gender or orientation, in my opinion feel free to send this to your lover or someone you like! (it will have a button from 11th to 16th of february, 'send a valentine') i might do a best friend valentines picture too :3

description: Happy New Year to all! Here's Mochi (rabbit) and Pochi (penguin) viewing the New Year fireworks. I wasn't able to make a Christmas artwork for personal reasons, so I really pushed this new year one. As some of you might notice, I wasn't able to make my personal deadline for the hold close prints. D: But rest assured I will finish them as soon as I can- just have a bit of a slump and some other things going on. I should practice meeting the deadlines I set for myself- one of my new years resolution then, lol. I dont really bother making New Years resolutions because I just make resolutions every now and then. ahahahaha Anyway, hope you guys like my work! And may you all have a prosperous new year!

description: They say I'm to young to understand The pain of a broken heart Just a adolescent with uncontrollable emotions That i'll forget as I grow They're probably right A callused heart, Romance is dead I never want to love again They say I'll change my mind when I'm older My promise is shallow They're probably right But With every love song I hear With every fairy tale lie With every day dream dimmed It's a reminder that Even if they're right It still hurts I promised myself I wouldn't post anything till page two was out, but when that notice that the Valentine card thing was on, well.. I'm a sucker for those things! The only problem is Valentines Day is kinda a sick joke to me right now. The thing is, due to recent... boy issues I've completely rejected personal romance. It was a mix of sadness and anger, but the worst part is, we never dated, heck, he never knew I liked him, so I feel I have no right to feel mad at him for breaking my heart. After I mentally gave up, I realized my passion for romance and emotion (with was a very strong quality) was gone. My day dream about finding love were replaced by complete indifference. Adults kept reminding me that I am only 15, but they don't realize what a complete 360 my emotions went through. Even my love of shipping took a dip. Anyway, sorry for the monologue, I usually don't ever let my feelings interfere with my art work, since my main goal is to entertain watchers, but I couldn't bring myself do a puff piece. My original plan was to do something humerus of me throwing Cupid in a trash compactor, but since I'v had Prisoner/Paper Airplanes on a loop for the entire day last half hour, i decided to just go with my gut and do something out and out depressing and hope I'm not the only one who gotta bone to pick with St. Valentine. Happy signal awareness day! EDIT: After looking back on this picture the next morning, I realized it just wasn't my best, so I touched it up a bit.

description: Pluie d'Amour / Rain of Love Nahum January 10, 2003 - May 3, 2010 - Rest in Peace my Love Nahum Lovers will immediately recognize Nahum with is incredible speckled nose in the shape of heart. It is a re-done. I have worked this past night on the composition (trying to crop it on the right place), adding more contrast on the nose and fur, remove ice blue halo due to the high key (with white very shiny fur and white background, the details was lost). Yes finally I have decided to work on the third edition of my Ferrets Calendars. I receive asks for it since this summer ! Yesterday after work I have forced myself to go through my photos files. I think my heart will never heal. In fact I spend my time to cry, and finally only chose FEBRUARY month with this photo of Nahum : Pluie d'Amour. Friends and family fella please understand that I am in emotional mood right now, and will do my best to go through and will try to build the new calendar. Love, Hugs, Tears, Thoughts for Nahum can be deposed on : Nahum'sjournal Fan page on facebook : facebook Blog : marie-agnesphotography.blogspot.com/ Website : theferretstudio.com Zazzle store : www.zazzle.com/yukkabelle

description: Buy this in my stores: Society6 and RedBubble Edit:I was very unhappy with the effect of the original version, so I ran it through photoshop and found the right ambiance I wanted! Hope he's scarier now! - Halloween being one of my favorite holidays, and Sauron being one of my favorite Legendarium characters, I had no choice but to draw him as Annatar doing his evil, human sacrificing witch-doctor style. Technique The shading is all traditional, with only a bit tune-up of the contrast in PS, but no digital touch-ups at all. I used mainly 2B-6B pencils and q-tip and finger smudging to make the detailed shading. I always forget how fun this technique actually is. Is it very easy and rather quick compared to doing cross-hatchings with hard pencils, which is my usual go-to technique. Idea It was an idea that just popped into my head a few weeks ago, and thus being one of the quickest and most detailed drawings I've made in months, with 20-25hours of work. I was inspired by voodoo witch-doctors, which is something that really freaks me out. I've always been intrigued by the skull-facepaint but never gotten to do it, so this was a two-in-one idea, really. It sprung from the story of Sauron Annatar (I dont really know if he called himself Annatar while he had his fun with Numenor, I didnt find a specification, but I really like that name for him in that period, so I just go for that) as he sacrifices humans to Morgoth in Valinor (hence the screaming faces in the smoke) and I always pictured him kind of like a witch-doctor, mad and beautiful while corrupting the hearts of men. I could've put more thought into his costume, but I really didn't bother with all the shading I had to do, I hope you can forgive me. (And no he is not naked, he is wearing a skirt with a birdskull on the belt, as you can see.) All in all I am very happy with him, even though I know the anatomy is a bit off. It is always like that with my A4 pieces, I cannot for the life of me understand why, but the proportions are all distorted when I work in that format. I have to find out why.. I hope you like him, and HAPPY HALLOWEEN!! Cheers, Iggy PS. everyone be safe! pps. Oh and yes that is a necklace with human eyes on it, because obviously Sauron would be collecting the eyes of his victims. That much is obvious...

description: "bloodied knuckles, but im not dead" so I decided to take part in deviantarts pride contest! As a trans guy who heavily prefers other men, I love pride time! When I first realized I was trans, I fell into a really heavy depression, self harming a lot as well as getting into fights. I drew this and picked healing, because its a common occurrence for other lgbt people, and I hope in the future we can all heal. one hand has bloody knuckles from fighting, the other has self harm scars. Either way, both will heal over time. if you like this, maybe check out my links here. My site|My store|My facebook|My Redbubble Have a good pride everybody! edit: info for anybody interested! Time taken: 4 hours (a long time for me, im generally a fast artist) Layers: 20 tablet: Wacom Intuos pen and touch small program: paint tool SAI
